text:
Amazon EFS Archive is a new storage class that 
is cost-optimized for cold, rarely-accessed data

giving you a cost-effective way 
to retain even your coldest data

so that it’s always available 
to power new business insights.

With the addition of this storage class to Amazon 
EFS, you can now choose from three storage classes

to meet the price and performance needs 
of your workloads or applications.

EFS Archive supports the same intelligent tiering 
experience as existing EFS storage classes,

which means that you can now combine the 
sub-millisecond SSD performance

of Amazon EFS Standard for your active
frequently-accessed data

with the lower costs of Amazon EFS Infrequent 
Access and EFS Archive for your colder data.

When needed, all your data – across EFS Standard,
IA, and Archive storage classes –
is easily accessible from a single EFS file system

that’s automatically cost-optimized 
for a mix of active and inactive data.

With EFS Archive, you can now easily and 
cost-effectively share large file-based datasets
for a wide-spectrum of use cases  –

from data analytics to machine learning training
to SaaS applications  –

with the same instant access, gigabytes-per-second
throughput performance,

and eleven-nines of durability
that Amazon EFS already delivers today.
